critique: This executive order focuses on streamlining and standardizing the process of determining the fitness and suitability of federal employees and contractors. It emphasizes reciprocal recognition of prior favorable determinations and reinvestigation of individuals in positions of public trust. There is no immediately obvious ideological tilt. It doesn't directly address immigration. It delegates authority to the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) and agency heads, but doesn't dramatically expand or restrict executive power. It doesn't significantly shift power between the federal government and the states. It touches on national security by addressing reinvestigations for public trust positions, but also emphasizes individual suitability. It doesn't directly regulate the economy. It doesn't explicitly promote or hinder social inclusion, focusing instead on standardizing background checks. Therefore, most scores should be neutral.
